translated:
Carl Salomon, practical physician, Växjö, born on January 28, 1897 in Haltostad to chief postal employee Emil W. and Mathilda Benigtsson. Married on June 21, to author Ingrid Katarina Holmqvist. Children: Bengt-Göran (born in 1922), Alf Emil (born in 1928), Ulla Lena (born in 1929). - Graduated from high school in Halmstad in 1915, received a Bachelor of Medicine degree in Lund in 1919, received a medical license in Stockholm in 1924. Substitute district medical officer in Älvsbyn, Äknihult, and Malung districts from 1922 to 1924; assistant at Karlolinska Institute Dermato-Syphilidology Clinic from 1921-1925; substitute clinical assistant there from 1925-1926; substitute district medical officer in Sunne, Lycksele, and Strängnäs districts for about a year from 1925-1929; substitute clinical assistant at Västervik and Halmstad hospitals, Seraf Hospital Surgical Ward, and Gothenburg's BB for approximately fifteen months from 1926-1928; second clinical assistant at Växjö hospital from 1920-1931; first substitute district medical officer there from 1931-1934; substitute hospital physician for three months; practicing physician in Växjö since 1934. Studied in Vienna in 1921, annual travel from 1928-1939. Writings: Syphilis (prize-winning contest paper in the series "What We Know"), essays in professional journals, lectures on medical subjects in Lecture Hall and ABF. 

Ingrid Katarina, author, Växjö, born in Karlskrona to Blekinge descriptive writer J.O. Holmqvist and his wife. Married on June 21 to practical physician Carl W. - Graduated from elementary school in 1911, language studies at a high school in Stockholm. Traveled in Europe annually from 1928-1939. Employed in small and primary schools in Skatelöv, Torhamn, and Älmhult from 1911-1925. Board member of the State Continuing School for Speech Education in Växjö from 1938, member of the Women's Preparedness Chamber, member of the Växjö Youth Council. Writings: Lillköpingsbarnen, reading book for elementary school (I and II, 1927), Gullstugan, supplementary reading book for elementary school (1933), Manual for Fröbelwork, Stick Craft (1924), Children's Song Collection: Knäckkalaset (1924), Sockerlandet (1927), Lillebrors visor (1932), Reading book on hygiene and health. Health ABC book (1933, also translated into Norwegian), Children's First Christmas Book, Christmas reading for beginners (1932), Tomtenisse, Christmas reading for beginners (annual since 1933), Bevingat folk (in the series "Our Wonderful World", 1933), A straw for the bee (in the same series, 1946), We want to be healthy (same series, 1948), In Hoppareland, informative and entertaining reading for beginners (1944), The King's Little Doctor (1944), Us and Our Health (1948). Contributed to and collaborated on unpublished works and radio programs for children from 1925. Collaborated on reading books for elementary school and "My Schoolmate."
